intro: Pyrus danubialis, commonly known as the Danube pear, is a deciduous tree native to Central Europe. It belongs to the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its ornamental white flowers and yellowish-green fruits. The plant typically grows to a height of 5–10 meters and prefers well-drained soils. It is often cultivated for its aesthetic value in gardens and parks. The fruit, though edible, is not as widely consumed as other pear varieties.
